summary: This is an email chain from August 15, 2019, forwarding a request for Lieutenant names from the Western Regional Office to be assigned to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The email discusses the temporary assignment (TDY) of two GS-11 Lieutenants from FCC Tucson, noting they cannot be sent at the same time.

events.title: Request for Lieutenant Assignments to MCC NY
events.description: An email chain discusses the temporary assignment (TDY) of two GS-11 Lieutenants from FCC Tucson to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, with a note that the warden cannot lose them at the same time.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 15, 2019, which is the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
It discusses the temporary assignment of two Lieutenants from FCC Tucson to MCC New York.
The request specifies that the Lieutenants are GS-11 grade and cannot be sent at the same time due to operational needs at their home facility.
The correspondence involves the Correctional Services Administrator at the Western Regional Office.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it relates to post-death staffing or security reviews at the facility where he died.
